fields.name: Goblin
fields.description: A small, green humanoid with a mischievous grin, often found in caves or abandoned ruins.
fields.excerpt: A common low-level enemy that attacks in packs.

fields.name: Orc
fields.description: A brutish and warlike humanoid with a deep connection to chaos and destruction.
fields.excerpt: A dangerous foe with crude weapons and savage tactics.

fields.name: Dragon Wyrmling
fields.description: A young dragon still learning to control its breath weapon and wings.
fields.excerpt: Smaller than an adult dragon but just as deadly.

fields.name: Dire Wolf
fields.description: A giant wolf with feral instincts, often found in the wilderness.
fields.excerpt: Known for its ferocity and ability to knock prey prone.

fields.name: Skeleton
fields.description: An undead creature made of bones, animated by dark magic.
fields.excerpt: A staple of necromantic armies, fragile but relentless.

fields.name: Zombie
fields.description: A slow-moving undead with decayed flesh and relentless endurance.
fields.excerpt: Its resilience makes it hard to put down.

fields.name: Troll
fields.description: A regenerating giant with a vicious appetite for destruction.
fields.excerpt: Healing wounds rapidly unless fire or acid is used.

fields.name: Beholder
fields.description: A floating orb of flesh with a central eye and deadly eye rays.
fields.excerpt: One of the most iconic and terrifying creatures in D&D.

fields.name: Fire Elemental
fields.description: A blazing creature of living fire, leaving destruction in its wake.
fields.excerpt: Engulfs enemies in flames with every attack.

fields.name: Gelatinous Cube
fields.description: A transparent ooze that engulfs and dissolves anything it touches.
fields.excerpt: Deadly traps for adventurers in dungeons.

fields.name: Treant
fields.description: A sentient tree that protects its forest with overwhelming strength.
fields.excerpt: A guardian of nature, capable of summoning allies.

fields.name: Kobold
fields.description: A small, reptilian humanoid often found in mines and caves.
fields.excerpt: Tricky and cowardly, but dangerous in numbers.

fields.name: Mind Flayer
fields.description: An intelligent aberration with psionic powers and a taste for brains.
fields.excerpt: Feared for their mind control abilities.

fields.name: Wyvern
fields.description: A dragon-like creature with a deadly stinger.
fields.excerpt: Fierce aerial predators with venomous tails.

fields.name: Lich
fields.description: An undead spellcaster who has achieved immortality.
fields.excerpt: Powerful and cunning, with vast magical knowledge.

fields.name: Hydra
fields.description: A multi-headed monstrosity that grows more heads when wounded.
fields.excerpt: Challenging to defeat due to its regenerative abilities.

fields.name: Harpy
fields.description: A winged humanoid with a hypnotic song.
fields.excerpt: Lures prey with its captivating melodies.

fields.name: Medusa
fields.description: A cursed humanoid whose gaze turns creatures to stone.
fields.excerpt: Deadly and tragic, often seeking solitude.

fields.name: Griffon
fields.description: A majestic creature with the body of a lion and the wings of an eagle.
fields.excerpt: Often used as mounts by brave warriors.

fields.name: Phoenix
fields.description: A fiery bird that reincarnates upon death, leaving ashes behind.
fields.excerpt: A symbol of rebirth and destruction.
